you see your ability to detect color and
resolve detail drops off considerably
the edge of your visual field but your
ability to detect motion actually
increases that's because the periphery
of your retina has fewer cones the light
sensing cells that excel at detecting
color and shape and more rods which are

patterns even where none exists we've
talked about this before in the context
of seeing faces in rocks or toast that
happens because our primate brains
evolved to quickly recognize one another
and that ability comes with a side

forms in otherwise random patterns turns
out this isn't just a visual thing we're
so keen on recognizing other humans that
we often hear human voices that aren't

static and amplified background noise

experiments from both white noise and

in this case there was a specific
